wpa_passphrase netwrk pasword > wpa.conf: then the next step depends on your wireless device, what type is it, and what is the interface name (eg.eth1, wlan0, etc.)
what I do next is "sudo wpa_supplicant -Dwext -i wlan0 -c ./wpa.conf"
then you should see some messages, it should be obvious if everything is ok or not.  If it is ok, switch to another console and do "sudo dhclient wlan0"
